MemberSignature.Value: public string ExtractMessageCode (string message, out string messageWithoutCodePrefix);
.method public hidebysig instance string ExtractMessageCode(string message, [out] string& messageWithoutCodePrefix) cil managed
Public Function ExtractMessageCode (message As String, ByRef messageWithoutCodePrefix As String) As String
public: System::String ^ ExtractMessageCode(System::String ^ message, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % messageWithoutCodePrefix);
member this.ExtractMessageCode : string * -> string

Docs.param: The full message to parse that includes code prefix.
The message with the code prefix removed.
Docs.summary: Extracts the message code prefix from the given full message string.
Docs.returns: The message code prefix that is extracted from the full message string, or if there is no message code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Message code prefixes must match the following .NET regular expressions in order to be recognized: `^\s*[A-Za-z]+\d+:\s*`.
## Examples If this method is given the full message string `MYTASK1001: This is an error message.` and it accepts `This is an error message.` as the value for the `messageWithoutCodePrefix` parameter, then it returns `MYTASK1001`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string FormatResourceString (string resourceName, params object[] args);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string FormatResourceString(string resourceName, object[] args) cil managed
Public Overridable Function FormatResourceString (resourceName As String, ParamArray args As Object()) As String
public: virtual System::String ^ FormatResourceString(System::String ^ resourceName, ... cli::array <System::Object ^> ^ args);
abstract member FormatResourceString : string * obj[] -> string override this.FormatResourceString : string * obj[] -> string

Docs.param: The name of the string resource to load.
Optional arguments for formatting the loaded string.
Docs.summary: Loads the specified resource string and optionally formats it using the given arguments.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The culture of the current thread is used for formatting.
This method requires the owner task to have registered its resources with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.TaskResources%2A> property.

Docs.exception: The string resource indicated by does not exist.
The property of the owner task is not set.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.
Docs.value: The prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If a task does not have Help keywords associated with its messages, it can ignore this property or set it to `null`. If this property is set to an empty <xref:System.String>, resource names will be used verbatim as Help keywords.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object InitializeLifetimeService ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object InitializeLifetimeService() cil managed
Public Overrides Function InitializeLifetimeService () As Object
public: override System::Object ^ InitializeLifetimeService();
override this.InitializeLifetimeService : unit -> obj

Docs.summary:
InitializeLifetimeService is called when the remote object is activated.
This method will determine how long the lifetime for the object will be.
Thread safe. However, InitializeLifetimeService and MarkAsInactive should only be called in that order, together or not at all, and no more than once.
Docs.returns: The lease object to control this object's lifetime.

MemberSignature.Usage: taskLoggingHelper.LogError (subcategory, errorCode, helpKeyword, file, lineNumber, columnNumber, endLineNumber, endColumnNumber, message, messageArgs)

Docs.param: The description of the error type.
The error code.
The Help keyword to associate with the error.
The path to the file containing the error.
The line in the file where the error occurs.
The column in the file where the error occurs.
The end line in the file where the error occurs.
The end column in the file where the error occurs.
The message.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
Docs.summary: Logs an error using the specified message and other error details.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The parameters `subCategory`, `errorCode`, `helpKeyword`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.

Docs.summary: Logs an error using the message from the specified exception.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LogErrorWithCodeFromResources (string messageResourceName, params object[] messageArgs);
.method public hidebysig instance void LogErrorWithCodeFromResources(string messageResourceName, object[] messageArgs) cil managed
Public Sub LogErrorWithCodeFromResources (messageResourceName As String, ParamArray messageArgs As Object())
public: void LogErrorWithCodeFromResources(System::String ^ messageResourceName, ... cli::array <System::Object ^> ^ messageArgs);
member this.LogErrorWithCodeFromResources : string * obj[] -> unit

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
Docs.summary: Logs an error with an error code using the specified resource string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the message begins with an error code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message. The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix. A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the message begins with an error code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message. The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix. A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.
The parameters `subCategoryResourceName`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.

## Remarks The parameters `subCategory`, `warningCode`, `helpKeyword`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LogWarningWithCodeFromResources (string messageResourceName, params object[] messageArgs);
.method public hidebysig instance void LogWarningWithCodeFromResources(string messageResourceName, object[] messageArgs) cil managed
Public Sub LogWarningWithCodeFromResources (messageResourceName As String, ParamArray messageArgs As Object())
public: void LogWarningWithCodeFromResources(System::String ^ messageResourceName, ... cli::array <System::Object ^> ^ messageArgs);
member this.LogWarningWithCodeFromResources : string * obj[] -> unit

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
Docs.summary: Logs a warning with a warning code using the specified resource string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the message begins with a warning code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message. The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix. A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LogWarningWithCodeFromResources (string subcategoryResourceName, string file, int lineNumber, int columnNumber, int endLineNumber, int endColumnNumber, string messageResourceName, params object[] messageArgs);

The path to the file containing the warning.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the message begins with a warning code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message. The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix. A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.
The parameters `subCategoryResourceName`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.

Docs.summary: Notifies this that it is no longer needed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is thread safe, however, you must call both InitializeLifetimeService and MarkAsInactive, in that order, or you must call neither method, and you must call neither method than once.
